rComments: She's really not as bad as people are making her out to be. Just pay attention to what she SAYS as well as what's on the slides and you'll do fine, especially since she repeats everything multiple times. Lots of material to cover, but it was doable.

She's the worst instructor I ever had.  She didn't seem familiar with the slides in lecture, and brought a heavy load of  negative energy into the classroom.  I managed to get a decent grade, but only because I worked tirelessly.  She refused to correct mistakes she made on exams, despite my showing her in the text that my answer was correct.

Learned loads from this class. Grades really does represent how much you know in this class. First, I took this class. Failed. Didn't learn anything. Second time around, I received an A-. Learned Lots. Lecture notes were confusing/unorganized so go to office hours to clarify. She is extremely helpful if you show you want to learn.

This class requires complete memorization on lecture notes. Make sure you have the complete set of lecture notes because the exams are 100% based on these. To do well on all three exams you must have Noren's lecture notes completely memorized. There's no curve in this course! A 69.45% average is the bare minimum requirement to pass this class!

There's a major reason Kramer has so many low ratings... and this should be a fascinating subject! But no, there's an overwhelming degree of stress because her test averages are LOW; many of the 100 multiple choice questions are often unfairly specific.  The class is not designed to have you learn, but rather, regurgitate TONS of powerpoint facts.

This is probably the worst teacher I have had. Not only is she completely disrespectful to her students, she is also not knowledgeable on her teaching material and "borrows" most of her lecture slides from others. She is a poor test writer. When the avg was 57%, she asked her students why they were so lazy. AVOID.

I think she was pretty easy and straightforward. Everything is in the lecture. I suggest buy a recorder. The class is all MEMORIZATION!, which is basically what intro Biology is.. TA Ashley was mean/rude, but TA Angela was super nice!

Horrible teacher. Disrespectful to students. Clearly doesn't care about her students needs which were made very clear to her. Refuses to curve even when half the class fails a midterm. Doesn't like her job and it shows. I worked incredibly hard and still got a D. lectures are taken directly from the book and tests are ridiculous. AVOID.

Easy class. Learned much.  Very entertaining lectures(gotta write fast!).  I got an A going to every lecture blazed and ready to learn about plants (and animals brains) and only having to study five or six hours the night before each test. no curve because it is too easy to have one (but dr. kramer still offers extra credit) awesome class, no hw!

Absolutely awful. Not only are her power points poorly organized, but she also goes though them way too fast. If you you ask her too slow down she won't. All her tests are based off her power points but it's really difficult to study for them when your notes are incomplete b/c she wouldn't slow down. I could complain more but I'm running outta room

Do NOT take this class if you don't want to ruin your GPA. I've never failed a test before until I took her class. I went in to her Office hours to ask her how I improve in the class. She made me feel worse about the exam and made the girl before me cry. I don't get how she's still a teacher at this school. Advice: Read the book!

Take this class at a junior college. Do not take it with her. I was in the top 5% of class and got an A-. She's hostile, unapproachable, her tests are random questions thrown on a page, you may as well just record her lectures and sit back, because you can't write fast enough, you can barely TYPE fast enough. AVOID.

A disgrace to this university. She is extremely rude and condescending to her students. She would yell at us during class and tell us we did not take notes well, claiming she gave some fabulous lecture that we were suppose to hang off every word. Her lecture consisted of stolen powerpoints that she would read verbatim. Avoid her she is pure evil!

This lady should not be teaching! First off this class is on animal AND plant physiology but she knows absolutely nothing about plants (her knowledge of animal physiology seem pretty lacking as well though. It is clear that this class is unimportant to her as she uses other people's power points for her lectures. All she would do is read of of them

Kramer is the worst professor at UCSC. She is rude, disrespectful, and clearly shows a complete lack of interest in helping students. I have been to her office hours and she is either yelling at students or unable to answer questions. She should not be teaching this course. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS!

It's hard to take her seriously when she is constantly on a power trip. It's also obvious that her students are not one of priorities. If you want to do well in this course (which some see as seemingly impossible), study on your own from the book. trust me. I got an A.

Lectures all powerpoint & she goes by them very fast. if someone nicely asks to slow down, she just pauses & continues w/e she was saying or tells them "no". some of the important images she uses are NOT in the textbook. midterms & final are 100 multiple choices. not a good prof, no respect for students, and TA ashley is the worst.

Shawn Kramer is the worst professor that i've had here at UCSC. She does not show any interests for her students and is not helpful at all. One of her TA's Ashley is really rude and mean but Mitch was wonderful. Don't take her!!!!
